In nonfatal cases the increase in antibody titers around day 6 to 11 accompanies the recovery. The development of antigen-specific IgM and then IgG is accompanied by strong inflammatory responses, including TNF-Î± and IL-6 production. Whether these are markers of disease activity or have protective potential remains to be established. IgG antibodies are known to persist for many years after infection.
47,48 Although highly accurate, the currently used diagnostic tests have significant logistic challenges, including the requirements for high-level laboratory biosafety and staff with expertise in using sophisticated machines.
